p: Another study based on mice fed with diets containing either a 1.5% fatty acid preparation rich in conjugated linoleic acid (CLA) or rich in LA revealed that dietary CLA concurrently increases the activity and mRNA levels of enzymes involved in fatty acid synthesis and oxidation, as well as PUFAs desaturation in the mouse liver, which appears to be mediated by both the activation of PPAR-Î± and upregulation of SREBP-1 (sterol regulatory element binding protein-1) [ 45].
